metadata.Title: CVE-2018-8043 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The unimac_mdio_probe function in drivers/net/phy/mdio-bcm-unimac.c in theLinux kernel through 4.15.8 does not validate certain resourceavailability, which allows local users to cause a denial of service (NULLpointer dereference).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8043` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-13.14
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-13.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1006-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1006.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1159-aws - 4.15.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-azure - 4.15.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1003-azure - 4.15.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1003-gcp - 4.15.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.15.0-1003-gcp - 4.15.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1143-kvm - 4.15.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1002-oem - 4.15.0-1002.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-13.14').
linux-raspi2 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1006.7').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1003.3').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1003.3').
linux-oem package in esm-infra/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1002.3').
